    Various utility methods for the XStream technology.

    SkyCrawl

    • Method Detail

      • getSerializerWithProcessedAnnotations

        public static com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream getSerializerWithProcessedAnnotations(java.lang.Class<?>... annotationsToProcess)
        Creates a XStream object that registers all given classes and processes their annotations. The returned object is suitable to be passed to other methods of this class or have its XStream#toXML() and XStream#fromXML() methods called right away.

      • serializeToXML

        public static java.lang.String serializeToXML(java.lang.Object objectToSerialize,
                              com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream serializer)
        By default, XStream doesn't add XML declaration to the result files. This method first writes: 
        <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
         and then writes the object's XML representation.
        Returns:
        XML representation of the object, with a proper XML declaration

      • serializeToFile

        public static void serializeToFile(java.lang.String filePath,
                   java.lang.Object objectToSerialize,
                   com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream serializer)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Outputs the result of serializeToXML(Object, XStream) to a file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • deserializeFromPath

        public static <T> T deserializeFromPath(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                        java.lang.String path,
                        com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream deserializer)
        Deserializes an object with the given class to an object from the given file using the given deserializer.

      • deserializeFromXML

        public static <T> T deserializeFromXML(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                       java.lang.String xml,
                       com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream deserializer)
        Deserializes an object with the given class to an object from the given XML string representation using the given deserializer.
